wikipedia_page.main: Group Captain Charles Eric St John Beamish (23 June 1908 – 18 May 1984) was an Irish rugby player and Second World War RAF pilot. He gained 12 caps for Ireland as a prop forward and also represented the British Isles on their 1936 tour of Argentina. He was one of the Beamish brothers - elder brother George also played for Ireland, and other brothers Victor and Cecil were also accomplished sportsmen and RAF officers.

response: 1936: Bernard Gadney, Alexander Obolensky, Charles Beamish

link_mentions.page: List of international rugby union families
List of Leicester Tigers players selected for international rugby

response: Personal honours for the players masked some of the decline though.  Bernard Gadney became the club's first home produced England captain in 1934 and was captain when four Leicester players were part of the first England side to beat the All Blacks.  Tigers winger Alexander Obolensky scored two tries on debut in the 13–0 win.  Gadney also became the club's second player to captain the British Lions on their tour to Argentina where he was joined by Obolensky and Charles Beamish.
